definition: wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn

sentences.english: The liner ran down a fishing-boat during the dense fog.
sentences.chinese: 在濃霧中，客輪撞翻了一條漁船。

sentences.english: The attack marked the 1st time that a ship of the Nautica's size had been targeted by pirates.
sentences.chinese: 據悉，這一級別的客輪成爲海盜襲擊目標尚屬首次。

sentences.english: The liner is reported to have been in collision with an oil tanker.
sentences.chinese: 據報道，這艘客輪與一艘油輪相撞。

sentences.english: The passengerliner laboured in the ruffled sea.
sentences.chinese: 客輪在波浪翻滾的海面上顛簸。

sentences.english: His ship hooted for three times and started.
sentences.chinese: 他乘坐的客輪鳴了三聲汽笛後啓航了。

sentences.english: A big ssenger ship hung up on a sandbar for several hours.
sentences.chinese: 一條大客輪擱淺在沙州已有幾個小時了。

sentences.english: The captain of the passagership has the safety of thousands of lives in his keeping.
sentences.chinese: 這艘客輪上幾千名乘客的生命安危全維繫於船長一人。

sentences.english: It only takes you 1 hour to Putuo mountain with High-speed liner.
sentences.chinese: 乘高速客輪僅1小時可到達海天佛國普陀山。

sentences.english: One new passenger liner was launched down the ship-way yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 一般新的定期客輪昨天從這個船臺下水了。

sentences.english: Indeed, several passenger ships have run aground in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，近年來確實有數艘客輪在那裏擱淺。

sentences.english: Scobie went out in the police boat as soon as the liner anchored.
sentences.chinese: 客輪一拋錨，斯考比馬上坐着警察局的汽艇迎了出去。

sentences.english: A passenger ferry in Turkey has been hijacked off the northwestern port of Izmit.
sentences.chinese: 土耳其一艘客輪在西北港口伊茲米特被劫持。

sentences.english: Our ship stranded near the submerged reefs.
sentences.chinese: 我們的客輪在暗礁附近擱淺了。

sentences.english: The liner run down a fishing-boat during the dense fog.
sentences.chinese: 在濃霧中，客輪撞翻了一條漁船。

definition: (of a ship) to strike a reef/(fig.) to hit a snag
Spratly Islands, disputed between China, Malaysia, the Philippines, Taiwan and Vietnam
